questions.question: What is the chemical formula of MIL-88B?
What type of reactions does MIL-88B facilitate for organonitrile, alkyne, and alkene monomers?
How does the unit-cell volume of the product crystals compare to the most-open form of MIL-88B after the CTC reactions?
questions.answer: The unit-cell volumes of the product crystals are larger than that of the most-open form of MIL-88B.

questions.question: What is the role of the Fe3 coordination template in the CTC reactions?
questions.answer: The Fe3 coordination template fixes three molecules in an ideal configuration to facilitate the [2 + 2 + 2] CTC reactions.

questions.question: What happens to the framework flexibility and gas adsorption performance of MIL-88B after the CTC reactions?
questions.answer: The framework becomes more rigid and the gas adsorption performance drastically improves.

questions.question: True or False: The CTC reactions in MIL-88B require a high reaction temperature and a catalyst.
True or False: The intermediate state with three 4-pyCN monomers simultaneously coordinating at the same Fe3 coordination template was observed by diffraction techniques.
What is the effect of using 3-cyanopyridine (3-pyCN) as a monomer in the CTC reaction?
questions.answer: The expected trimeric product of 3-pyCN cannot be obtained, indicating that MIL-88B cannot catalyze the trimerization reactions involving monomers with unsuitable coordination sites and molecular geometry.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Fe3 coordination template's arrangement in facilitating the CTC reactions?
questions.answer: The triangular arrangement of the Fe3 coordination template forces every three unsaturated groups of the monomer ligands to gather in a close configuration suitable for the cyclotrimerization reaction.

questions.question: True or False: The CTC reaction mechanism is mainly controlled by the organic reaction rather than the ligand substitution reaction.
